body.name: Rockford Fosgate P1683 Punch 6"x8" 3-Way Coaxial Full Range Speaker - Black (Pair)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by STEREOSOUNDSYSTEM.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 17 hrs 22 mins.
FREE delivery February 14 - 16. Order within 15 hrs 52 mins.
features: The Punch P1683 is an impressive 3-way full-range speaker designed for fanatics who need a high quality factory replacement in an easy to install package
The P1683 6”x8” 4-Ohm black speakers come as a pair, have a power handling of 65 Watts RMS/130 Watts Max and include mounting hardware and OEM adapter plate
Featuring a PEI dome tweeter with built-in crossover and injection molded mineral filled polypropylene cone with butyl rubber surround that provides high output and accurate frequency reproduction
FlexFit basket design utilizes slots instead of single screw sized holes that allow for a slight adjustment of the speaker when aligning with OEM mounting holes for a better fit
Famous Rockford Fosgate build quality with a full 1-year warranty
body.description: Audio Fanatics Upgrade their Factory Sound with Rockford Fosgate! P1683 The P1683 is a pair of 6”x 8” 3-way full-range speakers rated at 65 watts RMS and designed for audio fanatics needing a quality factory replacement. The P1683 offers a Flex Fit basket to ensure compatibility with odd shaped factory speaker locations and an ICC (Integrated Concealed Crossover), eliminating the need to mount any black boxes. The PEI dome tweeter provides accurate frequency reproduction as well as high volume output. The P1683 is exactly what you need to replace your OEM factory speakers with, impressive sounding speakers built with high quality materials in an easy to install package.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Audio Fanatics Upgrade their Factory Sound with Rockford Fosgate! P1683 The P1683 is a pair of 6”x 8” 3-way full-range speakers rated at 65 watts RMS and designed for audio fanatics needing a quality factory replacement. The P1683 offers a Flex Fit basket to ensure compatibility with odd shaped factory speaker locations and an ICC (Integrated Concealed Crossover), eliminating the need to mount any black boxes. The PEI dome tweeter provides accurate frequency reproduction as well as high volume output. The P1683 is exactly what you need to replace your OEM factory speakers with, impressive sounding speakers built with high quality materials in an easy to install package. Speaker Size: 6”x 8” Impedance: 4-Ohm Power Handling: 65 Watts RMS / 130 Watts Max Frequency Response: 65Hz - 24kHz Mounting Depth: 2.32"
The P1683 Includes: 1 Pair of 6”x 8” 3-way Full-Range SpeakersMounting Hardware

Flex Fit Basket Design The slot mounted frame pattern of the Flex Fit basket utilizes slots instead of single screw sized holes. This allows for a slight adjustment of the speaker when mounted for a better fit. Injection Molded Cone Our high strength injection molded polypropylene cone is rigid and lightweight to minimize any cone flex during use, improving the speakers overall sound quality while reducing potential distortion Integrated Crossover The Integrated Concealed Crossover hides the crosssover inside the basket, creating a cleaner look and easier installation. It also ensures the right frequencies are sent to the proper driver for the best quality sound with maximum protection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn't Be Happier! Bass is plenty, and highs are surreal!
reviews.reviewText: Best Thump-Bump for the money. I'm a bit of an audiophile but won't spend $$$ for extreme sound when these are affordable and sound amazing. Clear highs sound truly separated from the underlying bass line in a way that I've actually never heard in any of my friend's cars and is even hard to reproduce in a home surround system. You have to hear it to fully understand but you can have more bass and still hear the lyrics clearer and crisper than ever before.I actually turned my treble down a little at first because the tweeter and mid range was really standing out. Once I got them equalized on my aftermarket 16w RMS stereo it sounds great (Cheap Dual 5" screen stereo, I wouldn't recommend it unless you keep the WallyWord receipt to swap it out when it breaks early). After turning the bass up and mids down a few dB, the treble can be turned up just fine. I always turn mids down some, it's not the speakers. The cymbal hits were so crisp I could hear the cymbals resonating as they faded away over a strong bass line, like in real life. Yep, I was saying wow.I only have the front speakers installed so far and even with poor quality original rears the 2 front 6x8" Fosgates seem to put out as much bass as my factory 8" amplified sub, and they are punchier, more accurate sounding with a very satisfying rumble. However, for balanced sound I would recommend having an 8 or 10" sub. No reason to overdo the sub but it does add depth. This doesn't mean the speakers are weak and require a sub, in fact most people would be satisfied with the bass provided by 4 Fosgate Punches - at least using the 6x8 size.The cone is concave and exterior build quality is outstanding. I expect them to last. I did extensive research on all types of door speakers and spent a little more for these, glad I did.Further Review and Thoughts:My factory speakers are molded into a small box and these are just installed freely inside the door frame, I can definitely feel the sound resonating inside that un-tuned door. They would sound better with a small enclosure, maybe ported, but buidling / installing that would be tricky unless you use something like a Boom Mat speaker baffle (never tried them but probably helpful if it fits properly - see reviews). If anyone has used them with these speakers please comment, I suspect porting would do best since they are moving some air.I'm really excited to install the rears! Very easy to install and in the 05 Explorer the door panels couldn't be easier to remove. Cost wise you might be surprised what your factory speakers are selling for used on eBay. I can hopefully get enough to offset half my cost.These aren't designed to be turned way up to 11, you need something with higher RMS wattage for that but they are loud. Trust me, I doubt you'll return these for audio reasons nor want to upgrade after you get them equalized properly. If your stereo is factory, upgrade that first for best sound. I'm telling everyone to come sit and listen to at least 30 seconds of music.I used dielectric grease on the connectors but check to see if your car's wires have oxidized, mine had a black coating on the copper wire even tho it was stripped 3" back from the connector. This could affect transmission so I used a pocket knife to quickly scrape that off and make it shiny before attaching my blade connectors. Crimp them tight and check polarity!I needed small washers on the factory screw heads so they wouldn't dig into the mounting holes but hardware and clips are provided. I took the install opportunity to clean and spray my door hinges with white lithium grease and clean the door seams and window track. A window motor can last inevitably longer if dust and grit aren't causing resistance.Real-World Technical Aspects:Prices can't be beaten, pick up a couple sets, generally for best sound use the same speakers in all 4 doors. The magnet was strong in these by the way, that's a very good sign. I wouldn't worry about the mediocre sensitivity specs, it's not quite 90 dB or higher but the volume loudness was fine even with a relatively underpowered head unit.The frequency range also sounded full to me, I could hear and feel the low frequency lows very well and obviously they are producing the highs in blissful abundance. The crossover works beautifully to separate the frequencies and send them to the proper component. I assume this is one aspect where Rockford Fosgate's engineering is superior to lesser brands. My car came with premium sound, 2-way door speakers and a factory 8" sub but this fills the car with sound, blowing the old speakers out of the water and onto an eBay listing!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, nice sound
reviews.reviewText: These were really nice speakers and not too expensive great build quality and they have a very nice sound make sure you update your radio to get the max wattage so that way you get all the quality sound that the speakers can produce.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid replacement over stock
reviews.reviewText: If you’re looking to upgrade 4 by 6 speakers get these. They are more expensive than other brands but you’ll definitely notice where that extra money went. If you care enough about the sound quality to replace what you’ve got, go ahead and shell it out. With that said, keep in mind that they’re still 4 by 6 so they’re not gonna thump but you can hear every note from every instrument.

reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sounds like HI Fidelity crisp clearity imo
reviews.reviewText: Overall clearity of what io was hearing was instantly noticable. I was hearing crisp clearity & sounded more full, more alive with these in my front doors. I listen to Rock & metal, Loud almost always. if that matters For the price? Get em!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed at first, but then...wow!
reviews.reviewText: I put 4 of these in my F350 hoping to get some more mids and highs than the junk factory speakers powered off the head unit and not an Amp. I didn’t buy these for earth shattering bass as I planned to add a 10” sub after I resolved my mid and high issue. Installation was a breeze, turned on the Pioneer AVH-2500NEX and was like how can they sound worse?? Horrible crackling and clipping under medium volume. I almost pulled them and returned them but figured I would reset all of the previously saved audio settings first and start anew. I brought everything flat, no bass boost, no loudness, EQ flat. I got into the crossover setting and turned on the HPF to limit and immediately noticed a much cleaner sound. From there I began adjusting the EQ one at a time. I would turn the volume up listen for distortion and adjust accordingly. I spent about 2 hours doing this with various songs (rock, hip hop, electronic, alternative and country)...Sorry neighbors 😬. Once I felt like I had each EQ band set to my liking I cranked it up and holy cow. The highs are crystal clear, the mids are crisp and perfect, the lows are there but like I said not great, however there is zero distortion. Last weekend I added a 10” self powered sub by Cerwin Vega (also purchased here) and wow, I literally wouldn’t do anything different. My buddy who is a huge audiophile (spent over 8k on stereo for his boat) could not believe the amount of sound and clarity that came out of these speakers and my set up. He is now looking at the exact same set up for his truck (which has a factory Bose) as this sounds way better. If you aren’t willing to spend the time to fine tune the speakers or don’t have the knowledge, look at a different speaker. But if you know how to tune and are willing to take the time to make those adjustments, you can’t go wrong for the money!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The clarity is phenomenal, it does feel lacking at times cause they are 2way but still phenomenal speakers and are really crisp
Work great just had some issues on install

Packaging was in tact, quick delivery. Metra adapters did not fit on these though. I purchased this set and a set of JBL’s for the front of my F150. The adapter fit perfectly on the JBL’s but the Rockfords terminals were too wide for the adapter. Had to cut and solder the wires to make these work.Very happy with the sound quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great replacement for B&O Audi Q5
reviews.reviewText: These speakers are a great replacement to Audi B&O speaker. Nice upgrade in bass and they were not too hard to install. I have reuse the old mount and adapt it to fit the new speaker. A nice little DIY with a dremel.
Muy buenos altavoces ,sonido muy limpio y no distorsionan para mi street glide 2012…a falta de ponerme amplificador … rapidísimos en la entrega … un 10 /10 al vendedor !!
